channel.title: For anyone who actually knows Java
channel.description:
Hai everyone long time no see =]
anyway, to the point.
Mopar Servers are coded in Java. Then theoretically, couldn't we also code them in a simpler way, that doesn't require as much space, time, and it also is made from Java?
For instance "Scala"
It's a programming language. There is not much difference between it, and Java. This is what it looks like. Here is the canonical Hello world program written in Scala:
[code]object HelloWorld { def main(args: Array[String]) = Console.println("Hello, world!") }[/code]
Notice how similar it is to the stand-alone Hello World application for Java. The notable difference is that we do not declare anything to be static or void; the object keyword gives us a singleton object, freeing us from having to invoke any such constructs.
Then again, theoretically, could we not, rewrite all the mopar servers with Scala, and with our own customizable things?
I'm not saying it would be easy, it would be extremely hard, even our mopar servers aren't self coded. We got the cache from RuneScape.
Again, I'm not saying we should do it, but if one wanted to, would it be possible?

item.title: For anyone who actually knows Java
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

I want to start a server in C#, but I lack commitment

item.description:
@andrew01292 wrote:

Javas a ram whore. It would make server less laggy to switch to a new format, but it would take so much time it woudn’t be worth it.

item.title: For anyone who actually knows Java
item.dc:creator: @darkandlightjak5 darkandlightjak5
item.description:
@darkandlightjak5 wrote:

Yes, because of combining items. I’m not looking at the small picture here, I’m looking in all. As far as I am concerned, there aren’t a select few, there’s one, maybe two.

Read full topic

item.title: For anyone who actually knows Java
item.dc:creator: @Play_For_Keeps Play For Keeps
item.description:
@Play_For_Keeps wrote:

We don’t really have to wait for what runescape gives us…A select few know how to edit sprites…I have see dragon splatebody, black and rune party hats, and many other items created just in Private Servers.

Read full topic
item.source: For anyone who actually knows Java

item.title: For anyone who actually knows Java
item.dc:creator: @darkandlightjak5 darkandlightjak5
item.description:
@darkandlightjak5 wrote:

Well, not just for that, but all we have to work with now is what RuneScape gives us.

If we ever did convert, could we not make our own things to put in there.

For instance, if we wanted a horse, could we not model, and map out a fully interactive horse?

Read full topic
item.source: For anyone who actually knows Java

item.title: For anyone who actually knows Java
item.dc:creator: @Play_For_Keeps Play For Keeps
item.description:
@Play_For_Keeps wrote:

Converting to another language just isn’t worth the time. Are we going to spend days converting to another language just to save, what, 6 bytes of space?

Read full topic
item.source: For anyone who actually knows Java

item.title: For anyone who actually knows Java
item.dc:creator: @darkandlightjak5 darkandlightjak5
item.description:
@darkandlightjak5 wrote:

I think for one reason, because Java was was influenced by C++.

Therefore making C++ an older less advanced version of Java, and I’m not saying it’s obsolete, but it is older.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Rajae wrote:

Heck, why not code a server in C++, C, Delphi, or cobalt?

item.title: For anyone who actually knows Java
item.dc:creator: @darkandlightjak5 darkandlightjak5
item.description:
@darkandlightjak5 wrote:

Yes, but think about it. After you go past a certain limit, it starts to lag, and if you add too many things, you can’t walk without it freezing. So what I was thinking, if one ever did re-write the whole thing, would having not to declare voids, and such actually prevent lag?

Read full topic
item.source: For anyone who actually knows Java

item.title: For anyone who actually knows Java
item.dc:creator: @Tenacious_T Tenacious T
item.description:
@Tenacious_T wrote:

Actually thats not a bad idea… but what are to talk about “so much space”? Java isnt that big of a file…

Read full topic
